page.title: 08Transport
page.content: The main form of transport in this area is by road. There are no railway stations locally since the Richmond line was closed.The nearest railway stations being {Darlington}and{Northallerton. There are bus services that run between Catterick Village,Richmond and Darlington.The remaining parts of the area are without bus services. The main A1 carries a great deal of traffic except on Sundays.Heavy lorries,long distance buses and a range of commercial vehicles together with motor cars,all use the A1. The A1 is not a motorway but a dual carriageway with a speed limit of 60mph.Since the roundabouts at Catterick have been replaced by fly-overs in 1984 the traffic flow has improved.
